feed.title: Rocco's LinkedIn SSI Micro-Posts
feed.subtitle: Increase your Social Selling Index score with actionable insights

entry.title: Rocco's LinkedIn SSI: Micro-tip 1
entry.summary:
Polish Your Profile Picture

You wouldn't show up to an interview in your pajamas (hopefully). Your profile photo is your first impression.

Make it clear, professional, and smile like you just passed all your unit tests on the first try.

Follow me or drop a message if you’re unsure about your current photo! .

entry.title: Rocco's LinkedIn SSI: Micro-tip 2
entry.summary:
Write a Killer Headline

"Software Engineer" is fine. "JavaScript Wizard turning coffee into code" is better.

Make your headline punchy and specific. Show some personality.

Need a headline refresh? Connect with me or ping me. .

entry.title: Rocco's LinkedIn SSI: Micro-tip 3
entry.summary:
Banner Image = Free Billboard

Your banner is your personal marketing space. Use it!

Add a clean, relevant image or a message about what you do.

Want suggestions? Ask me anything! .

entry.title: Rocco's LinkedIn SSI: Micro-tip 4
entry.summary:
About Section: Don’t Make It a Résumé

Make it a story. Why do you code? What problems do you love solving?

Make it human. Not robotic. (Unless you're a robot. Then carry on.)

Follow me for more tips like this! .

entry.title: Rocco's LinkedIn SSI: Micro-tip 5
entry.summary:
List Your Skills (And Endorse Others)

Don’t be shy. Show off those TypeScript, React, and Svelte chops.

Endorse your colleagues too. Karma, baby.

Let’s skill-up your profile together. Message me. .

entry.title: Rocco's LinkedIn SSI: Micro-tip 6
entry.summary:
Request Recommendations

Social proof isn’t just for Amazon reviews.

Ask your team, mentors, or clients to say a few words. You deserve the praise.

Need a script to ask for one? Hit me up. .

entry.title: Rocco's LinkedIn SSI: Micro-tip 7
entry.summary:
Post Once a Week

Talk about what you’re learning, building, or thinking. Even bugs make good stories.

Stay consistent. Visibility beats perfection.

Need ideas on what to post? Ask away! .

entry.title: Rocco's LinkedIn SSI: Micro-tip 8
entry.summary:
Comment Like a Human

Commenting with real insight on posts shows you're alive and thinking.

"Nice post" is not insight. Share your take.

Drop a comment on my posts and let’s start a convo. .

entry.title: Rocco's LinkedIn SSI: Micro-tip 9
entry.summary:
Connect With Intention

Don't just hit "connect" like you're playing Cookie Clicker.

Add a note. Mention a shared interest or goal.

Let’s connect the right way. Ping me anytime. .

entry.title: Rocco's LinkedIn SSI: Micro-tip 10
entry.summary:
Use Keywords Like a Dev Uses Git

Your profile should include keywords recruiters are searching for: languages, frameworks, cloud, etc.

Not keyword stuffing, but keyword seasoning.

Need help finding your core terms? Let’s chat. .

entry.title: Rocco's LinkedIn SSI: Micro-tip 11
entry.summary:
Headline = You in One Line

Make it short but impactful. Think movie tagline, not user manual.

Your title should tell people what you do and why they should care.

Need help refining yours? Just ask. .

entry.title: Rocco's LinkedIn SSI: Micro-tip 12
entry.summary:
Pin a Top Post

Have a post that got great engagement? Pin it.

It tells people right away what kind of thinker or builder you are.

Got a post in mind but not sure? Let’s chat. .

entry.title: Rocco's LinkedIn SSI: Micro-tip 13
entry.summary:
Feature Your Projects

Side project? Open source repo? Chrome extension that saves kittens?

Feature it on your profile.

Want help describing it well? Ping me. .

entry.title: Rocco's LinkedIn SSI: Micro-tip 14
entry.summary:
Celebrate Milestones

Finished a bootcamp? Landed a cert? Survived legacy code?

Post about it. Give your journey a spotlight.

Need help turning it into a post? I’m here. .

entry.title: Rocco's LinkedIn SSI: Micro-tip 15
entry.summary:
Join Relevant Groups

Find dev communities or industry groups and join the conversation.

Lurking is fine. Participating is better.

Want recs? I got a list. .

entry.title: Rocco's LinkedIn SSI: Micro-tip 16
entry.summary:
Be Curious in Comments

Asking questions in comments drives interaction and makes people want to respond.

Just don’t ask “Why?” on every post like a toddler.

Need good questions to ask? Let’s brainstorm. .

entry.title: Rocco's LinkedIn SSI: Micro-tip 17
entry.summary:
Engage on Mobile Too

Waiting in line? On the train?

Drop a thoughtful comment or respond to messages. Little bursts of activity keep you top of mind.

Need a content snack list? DM me. .
